text:
just pinging again. proposed file structure for crankshaft is up in the PR above. Please check it out voice any feedback you may have.

couple goals with the file structure - separate the variables and macros from the main css file.
separate crankshaft required code from the main css file.
around noon if no one has further thoughts’ we’ll go with this file structure, and start progressing on the next steps

*Does anyone want to own getting the initial documentation site setup?* I’m not talking having content in there. I’m just talking getting it to a point that it’s actually accessible via a URL. We’ll get content going after that step.
<https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft/issues/21>

Reminder if you’d like to make a logo for CrankShaft, please post one to this issue:
<https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft/issues/20>

by Friday of this week. Otherwise we’re going with something already submitted.
Didn’t hear from anyone opposing the file structure. Going to merge it into master to keep things moving.
Yeah, I think it works... untill it doesnt:)

anyone who can dedicate some time to help HubLize the grid css
<https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft/issues/33>

It would be appreciated.

Another item on our list add backward compatibility for the HS grid class names.
<https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft/issues/32>

for anyone popping into the channel from my posts in other channels.

This is CrankShaft:
<https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft>

We’re not yet to version 1.0 but you can help us get there, even small things like chiming in on conversations in the github or in this slack channel helps. Otherwise read the readme.
